name: Kennett House Bed & Breakfast

reviews.title: Thank you Gilja!
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the Kennett House and thoroughly enjoyed every one. Gilja was a wonderful hostess and very helpful with directions and things to do in the Brandywine area. She made us feel "at home". We LOVED the breakfasts so don't be put off by the previous post. They were delicious and homey and we sat for hours chatting with the other guests and Gilja herself.

reviews.title: Kennett House
reviews.text: We'll be back!

reviews.title: Truly magnificent B&B, great location, fabulous hosts!!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Kennett House based on the wonderful reviews we saw on Trip Advisor. We were looking forward to meeting Carol and Jeff the owners of the B and B who received very high ratings based on their gourmet breakfasts and personal touches. Unfortunately when we arrived, we found out that they had sold the B and B recently.. While the new owner was accommodating and pleasant, the breakfasts were not of gourmet caliber. They were very basic with pancakes being served one day and french toast the next. There was nothing creative and the owner was not even there for the first breakfast.. The other negative was that even though you get a private bathroom, you have to walk down the hall to get to it.. We are big b and b people and I have to say this one did not stand out. My recommendation to the new owner is to work on making those breakfast truly gourmet and different and provide some ideas as to what to do in the area. The inn is lovely and snacks are provided along with soft drinks, Again it would be a nice touch if the cookies provided were home made. Effort has to made to keep up the wonderful reputation of the former owners. Hopefully things will improve once the transition period has taken place. The suggestions I am making may sound petty but the b and b's that stand out are the ones that have these special touches.

reviews.title: Fabulous organized inn with terrific hosts
reviews.text: The location of the Inn is good within walking distance of Kennett Square which is a charming little town. We enjoyed having ice cream at the little Mexican ice cream place in town. They have a number of very unusual flavers. There is also a discount book store run by a senior citizen group which has a wonderful selection of deeply discounted books. Fun to brouse in..The Kennett Square Grill was very good but the Kennett Square Inn was not impressive. We did enjoy the wineries and the Chadds River Museum and Longwood Gardens. The area in general is well laid out with alot of interesting spots to see.

reviews.title: Comfort & Hospitality
reviews.text: Jeff & Carol provided our entire 8 person party a wonderful experience. My wife turned 40, and I organized a surprise party for her in a local restaurant (Half Moon, also highly recommended). Long before we arrived, Jeff and Carol were polite and responsive to inquiries and requests for information about the local area. In every response, their recommendations about places to eat, local wineries, museums, and other general information were spot on.

reviews.title: A magical weekend
reviews.text: Absolutely fabulous weekend...our hostess, Gilja, could not have been warmer or more accommodating. We stayed in the Delaware Room, which is actually a two room suite including the enclosed former sleeping porch; it was cozy and just large enough for the two of us and our stuff for three days. The bed linens were sumptuous and the decor is wonderful. The breakfast was outstanding and included fresh fruit in season and an omelet made from fresh local mushrooms. The building itself is an outstanding examply of early 20th Century Architechture, and we became intrigued. As we checked out, we hated to leave and gave Gilja a big hug and told her we'd definitely be back. We highly recommend the Kennett House; don't just stay one night, you won't regret it!

reviews.title: A home away from home!
reviews.text: I had a great stay at the Kennett House! I am traveling nearly every week for work, and it was refreshing to feel like I was at home for a week. Gilja made me feel welcome, comfortable and relaxed. The room was gorgeous, with fresh linens, a soft bathrobes and luxury soaps and lotions! All of the little details really make a big difference. Each morning, Gilja made me a delicious breakfast with several options, hot or cold, and fresh fruit from the local farmer's market. When I had some free time away from work, she suggested I go to the Longwood Gardens. This was one of the most beautiful places to visit, any time of the year! Kennett Square is a quaint little town with plenty of room to explore. For business travelers, it is only about 45 minutes to an hour from Philly - a nice esape from the city! If you need to get the airport, Gilja was very helpful at giving an alternative route to avoid heavy traffic! I would recommend Kennett House to anyone - business travelers or honey mooners or family get-a-ways!

reviews.title: A great stay...bfast needs improvement
reviews.text: We stayed at this bed and breakfast in Sept of 2007 and were very impressed with the house, the hostess, and the amenities and appointing of the rooms.

reviews.title: Beautifully maintained inn with a gracious hostess
reviews.text: The location is great, only a couple block walk to the quaint shops and restaurants in Kennett Square.

reviews.title: small but mighty!
reviews.text: The only complaint we had was with the breakfasts. For both mornings we had breakfast, it was not up to par with the breakfasts we've come to expect from excellent BandB's.

reviews.title: Great B & Bs of the world
reviews.text: This was a wonderful find. Beds (and rooms) were extremely comfortable and the hosts, Jeff and Carol couldn't have been more helpful. A beautiful area to explore and fabulous restaurants just a short step away. We would definitely go back - even though we have to travel "across the pond" to get there.

reviews.title: Felt like home!
reviews.text: My stay at the Kennett House was extraordinary. Jeff and Carol went out of their way to make sure that every need was met. The food, the room, the atmosphere, their attitude and enthusiasm was all better than expected and made a lasting impression. The rates were more than fair and affordable. I highly reccommend this establishment to anyone spending some time in the Bradywine Valley who wishes for extra comforts and wonderful food to enhance their experience. Anyone can stay at a hotel, but how often has a generic hotel added to the vacation? The Kennett House will guarantee that your experience doesn't began when you leave the hotel and end when you come back to rest. I can't wait to book my next stay and see what else the Brandywine Valley has to offer!

reviews.title: Kennett Square Bed and Breakfast
reviews.text: What a delightful place to end a wonderful day of travel in Pa. The house and rooms were delightful. The innkeepers assisted in all areas from where to eat and sites to visit in the area. Definitely a must to stop and visit this quaint town and inn in Kennett Square.

reviews.title: A trip highlight
reviews.text: We spent two weeks touring around Pennsylvania, and our stay at the Kennett House was one of our best experiences. The accomodations were lovely, and the amenities made us feel pampered. In fact, it became a benchmark for other stays: "If they only had coffee available like the Kennett House..." "If they only offered Internet access like the Kennett House..."

reviews.title: Very welcoming
reviews.text: Although the room was beautiful and the breakfasts incredibly delicious, it was the personal touch that Jeff and Carol bring to their innkeeping that really sets the Kennett House apart. They have mastered the exact balance of being helpful and available without being intrusive.

reviews.title: Great Attention to Detail
reviews.text: My husband and I were very pleased with our stay at Kennett House Inn B & B in Kennett Square, Pa. Our room had lots of thoughtful extras: robes, high quality linens, well-placed lamps, and it was spotless. The host Gilja took great pride in her breakfast, as well she should. Good food, perfectly served. Comfortable and friendly.

reviews.title: A lovely place to stay---impeccably maintained and well-managed.
reviews.text: Gilja does a fantastic job of maintaining this grand old Arts and Crafts style home and of taking care of her guests. We thought the breakfasts were great---I can't imagine needing more or better, and she was a lovely host. My husband and I like B&B's and would highly recommend this one to fellow travelers. It is a great place from which to explore the beautiful Brandywine Valley (highly recommend Longwood and the Brandywine Museum---we enjoyed both shuttle tours out of Brandywine...fantastic tour guides)

reviews.title: FABULOUS!
reviews.text: Not a fan of B&Bs but none the less have stayed in many throughout the U.S & Europe. The Kennett House is spectacular--- more like a boutique inn with its quality ammenities & tasteful decor. No detail is overlooked. The breakfasts are gourmet made with the freshest ingredients. Gilja is a hostess par excellence. We stayed in the Delaware Room, very private, very quiet. The Kennett House location is perfect. We walked to the Kennet Inn(just a restaurant-no rooms despite the name) & enjoyed lovely dinners outside on 2 consecutive evenings. A very short drive & we were at The Hagley, Winterthur, Longwood Gardens, Brandywine Museum, & wine tasdting at the winery. Leaving the Kennett House was painful after our luxurious stay. Gilja felt like a dear, dear friend.

reviews.title: PA's best B&B
reviews.text: This is a fantastic historic home, with many unique features. It's located really well, close to Brandywine Battlefield, right on the edge of Amish country, and within easy driving distance of Philadelphia. The town itself is very quiet and friendly, and the place lends itself to a relaxing stay away from the hustle and bustle of the big city.

reviews.title: This Innkeeper Pays Attention to Details
reviews.text: The rooms itself are all nicely updated, while retaining their authentic character. Bathrooms have all the amenities, including great supplies from high-quality soap and shampoo, to little touches like q-tips and cotton balls. It is these little accents that make the place so incredibly comfortable.

description: The Kennett House Bed and Breakfast offers guests the casual elegance of a magnificent granite foursquare mansion, just three miles from Longwood Gardens. Built in 1910, this Brandywine Valley, Arts & Crafts style B&B is nestled in the historic borough of Kennett Square, and features beautiful chestnut and rosewood woodwork, antique furnishings, and oriental rugs. The Kennett House is just a few minutes from Longwood Gardens, Winterthur Museum, Brandywine River Museum, and Hagley Museum.
